column1: text
informal statement The list $0$ followed by the empty list is the empty list. formal statement lemma cCons_0_Nil_eq [simp]: "0 ## [] = []"
informal statement The list constructor $x \# y$ is the same as the list constructor $x # y$. formal statement lemma cCons_Cons_eq [simp]: "x ## y # ys = x # y # ys"

informal statement The concatenation of a list with a singleton list is the same as the concatenation of the list with the singleton list. formal statement lemma cCons_append_Cons_eq [simp]: "x ## xs @ y # ys = x # xs @ y # ys"
informal statement If $x \neq 0$, then $x ## xs = x # xs$. formal statement lemma cCons_not_0_eq [simp]: "x \<noteq> 0 \<Longrightarrow> x ## xs = x # xs"

informal statement If $x$ is not $0$, then the result of stripping $x$ from the list $x :: xs$ is $x$ followed by the result of stripping $x$ from $xs$. formal statement lemma strip_while_not_0_Cons_eq [simp]: "strip_while (\<lambda>x. x = 0) (x # xs) = x ## strip_while (\<lambda>x. x = 0) xs"
informal statement The tail of a list with a single element is the empty list. formal statement lemma tl_cCons [simp]: "tl (x ## xs) = xs"
informal statement Two polynomials are equal if and only if they have the same coefficients. formal statement lemma poly_eq_iff: "p = q \<longleftrightarrow> (\<forall>n. coeff p n = coeff q n)"
informal statement If two polynomials have the same coefficients, then they are equal. formal statement lemma poly_eqI: "(\<And>n. coeff p n = coeff q n) \<Longrightarrow> p = q"
informal statement All but finitely many coefficients of a polynomial are zero. formal statement lemma MOST_coeff_eq_0: "\<forall>\<^sub>\<infinity> n. coeff p n = 0"
informal statement If the degree of a polynomial $p$ is less than $n$, then the coefficient of $x^n$ in $p$ is zero. formal statement lemma coeff_eq_0: assumes "degree p < n" shows "coeff p n = 0"

informal statement If the coefficient of $x^n$ in a polynomial $p$ is nonzero, then $n$ is less than or equal to the degree of $p$. formal statement lemma le_degree: "coeff p n \<noteq> 0 \<Longrightarrow> n \<le> degree p"

informal statement If the coefficients of a polynomial $p$ are zero for all indices greater than $n$, then the degree of $p$ is at most $n$. formal statement lemma degree_le: "\<forall>i>n. coeff p i = 0 \<Longrightarrow> degree p \<le> n"

informal statement If $n$ is less than the degree of a polynomial $p$, then there exists an index $i > n$ such that the coefficient of $x^i$ in $p$ is nonzero. formal statement lemma less_degree_imp: "n < degree p \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>i>n. coeff p i \<noteq> 0"
informal statement The coefficient of $x^n$ in the polynomial $0$ is $0$. formal statement lemma coeff_0 [simp]: "coeff 0 n = 0"
informal statement The degree of the zero polynomial is zero. formal statement lemma degree_0 [simp]: "degree 0 = 0"
informal statement If a polynomial is nonzero, then its leading coefficient is nonzero. formal statement lemma leading_coeff_neq_0: assumes "p \<noteq> 0" shows "coeff p (degree p) \<noteq> 0"

informal statement The leading coefficient of a polynomial is zero if and only if the polynomial is zero. formal statement lemma leading_coeff_0_iff [simp]: "coeff p (degree p) = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> p = 0"

informal statement If the coefficient of the $n$th power of a polynomial $p$ is zero, then either $p$ is the zero polynomial or the degree of $p$ is less than $n$. formal statement lemma eq_zero_or_degree_less: assumes "degree p \<le> n" and "coeff p n = 0" shows "p = 0 \<or> degree p < n"

informal statement If the coefficient of $x^d$ in a polynomial $p$ is zero, and $d$ is at least the degree of $p$, then the degree of $p$ is at most $d-1$. formal statement lemma coeff_0_degree_minus_1: "coeff rrr dr = 0 \<Longrightarrow> degree rrr \<le> dr \<Longrightarrow> degree rrr \<le> dr - 1"
informal statement The coefficient of a polynomial is equal to the coefficient of its representation. formal statement lemmas coeff_pCons = pCons.rep_eq
informal statement The coefficient of the constant term of a polynomial is the constant term. formal statement lemma coeff_pCons_0 [simp]: "coeff (pCons a p) 0 = a"
informal statement The coefficient of $x^n$ in $a + x p$ is the coefficient of $x^{n-1}$ in $p$. formal statement lemma coeff_pCons_Suc [simp]: "coeff (pCons a p) (Suc n) = coeff p n"

informal statement The degree of a polynomial with a leading coefficient is at most one more than the degree of the polynomial without the leading coefficient. formal statement lemma degree_pCons_le: "degree (pCons a p) \<le> Suc (degree p)"

informal statement If $p$ is a nonzero polynomial, then the degree of $p$ is one more than the degree of $p$ with a leading coefficient of $a$. formal statement lemma degree_pCons_eq: "p \<noteq> 0 \<Longrightarrow> degree (pCons a p) = Suc (degree p)"
informal statement The degree of a polynomial of the form $a + 0x$ is $0$. formal statement lemma degree_pCons_0: "degree (pCons a 0) = 0"

informal statement The degree of a polynomial with a nonzero constant term is one more than the degree of the polynomial without the constant term. formal statement lemma degree_pCons_eq_if [simp]: "degree (pCons a p) = (if p = 0 then 0 else Suc (degree p))"
informal statement The polynomial $0x^0$ is equal to $0$. formal statement lemma pCons_0_0 [simp]: "pCons 0 0 = 0"

informal statement Two polynomials are equal if and only if their leading coefficients are equal and their tails are equal. formal statement lemma pCons_eq_iff [simp]: "pCons a p = pCons b q \<longleftrightarrow> a = b \<and> p = q"

informal statement A polynomial is zero if and only if its leading coefficient is zero and its tail is zero. formal statement lemma pCons_eq_0_iff [simp]: "pCons a p = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> a = 0 \<and> p = 0"

informal statement Every polynomial can be written as $a + bx + cx^2 + \cdots$, where $a, b, c, \ldots$ are coefficients. formal statement lemma pCons_cases [cases type: poly]: obtains (pCons) a q where "p = pCons a q"

informal statement If $P(0)$ and $P(p)$ implies $P(a + xp)$ for all $a$ and $p$, then $P(p)$ for all $p$. formal statement lemma pCons_induct [case_names 0 pCons, induct type: poly]: assumes zero: "P 0" assumes pCons: "\<And>a p. a \<noteq> 0 \<or> p \<noteq> 0 \<Longrightarrow> P p \<Longrightarrow> P (pCons a p)" shows "P p"
